reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is aiming to be a fishing simulator, realistic fish habits, movement, etc. It's not too realistic that it takes away the fun of it being a game. It's very different from other fishing games I've played. I'd love to see what updates they add to make the game even better. It has a lot of kinks but I expected as much.

Pros:
- F2P
- Not pay to win, you can only buy exp boost or extra credits (earned by just playing the game)
- Lots of unique features from other fishing games
- Not just a catch & reel" game
- Easy to learn after a while
- Different fishing methods
- Pretty graphics/animations
- Other players are pretty helpful
date:
especially when trying to learn a new area
- All DLC content are just items obtainable in-game

Cons:
- Tutorial is bad

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fishing New York

Cast to the left of me, cast to my right
Cast out in front of me but I can’t get a bite
I’ve changed my tactics many times, tried lures and float
And now the bitter lashing rain has soaked right through my coat

Worms and Maggots, corn and flake on every size of hook
I’ve used up all the tricks I know, it seems I’m out of luck
The weather’s gone from bad to worse and now the wind’s a gale
I should be in a nice warm pub and supping pints of ale

Non anglers think we’re barmy and all who fish are mad
“To be obsessed with drowning worms is only for the sad”
But non angling folk have no idea of the Buzz when the line goes tight
And the adrenalin rush when the fish is on and the rod bends to the fight

Not every day is action packed with solid bites and takes
When your angling comes together with very few mistakes
There are days like this when nothing’s right and all you try’s in vain
Just fishing on with not a bite in the bitter lashing rain

Any size of fish would do, just to avoid a blank
What’s this! A twitch! About time too, my inert float just sank
I’m getting lots of bites at last,'though the fishless hours were rotten
Now it’s a bite with every cast and all before's forgotten

I have learned a bit and caught a few to finish off my day
Carefully I’ve set them free and watched them swim away
I am all packed up but before I go there is one last look to see
Whats the story for my credits and xp

Notice how everyone that is giving this game a bad review either has a computer not capable of running the game, or has only played for 20 minutes before giving their opinion. Community is another point I want to hit on. Everyone that ive ran into so far is willing to help the inexperienced and I love that! There are so many games now a days with bad communites that it can just ruin anyones time in a game. Don't hesitate to download this! I can't wait to see what they bring out next!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was somewhat skeptical about this game at first due to the free-to-play model, since F2P games have catfished me one too many times and most modern fishing games are pretty crappie. As it turns out, Fishing Planet is a kick bass simulator that has hands-down the most in-depth modeling of fishing as a whole. Licenses, catch/keep systems, leader lengths, tackle box storage, real and artificial baits...it's all here.

Everything from fish activity cycles to river drift is modeled in a way that's accurate, but still fun enough that you won't want the developer's head on a pike for making something that's as slow as the real thing is sometimes. The early game can be annoying since panfish are near-worthless for leveling up and will often make it difficult to get at the more valuable channel cats, which is a load of carp, but once you get over that hump, your options quickly open up for gear and species, and fights can become really cutthroat.

I played a lot of fishing games back on the NES/SNES, and even for someone as pickerel about their fishing games as I am, I'm enjoying Fishing Planet a lot.

...salmon.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Easily the best fishing game out there and not because there aren't many fishing games out there but because the game does a great job at immersion with beautiful visuals and audio and you can just relax.
Of course by relaxing, I don't mean that the game is easy, if you want to go for small fish go ahead, that's easy, but if you want some nice largmouth bass you gotta work for it!

DetailsThe game is full of small little awesome details. Like I only realized recently that there are actual fishes in the lake! I always thought that the game was random and it assigned a fish to your hook (based on location and bait etc...) when you caught one, but no that's not how it works! You can see them if the water is clear and shallow! They move around your bait, poke it, hit it and if you're convicing enough, they'll bite it!

Learning curveFirst thing I'd like to mention is that, you don't need to have any actual fishing experiences in real life to be able to play and enjoy this game!

The game can be hard at first, specially after you level up once or twice, all the new equipments that unlock can be overwhelming. There's a tutorial at the beginning of the game but it doesn't cover a lot of the stuff you'll need to catch bigger fish later in the game. So you'll have to look up tutorials and read item descriptions to figure out how to work with the new rod you just bought.

Although there are some pop up tutorials here and there after you level up, catch a new fish or buy something new, I'm not sure exactly how they are triggered, but they give you some essentional info about for example how to catch a new type of fish.

Fuzzy Logic, No RandomnessAlso there isn't an element of randomness to this game when it comes to catching fish, by that I mean that the game uses a fuzzy logic recognition system.

What does that mean?
It means that when you're trying to catch a fish by for example a retrieval method like Stop&Go (there are multiple retrieval methods in the game), your consistancy in luring the fish determines the quality of the fish. That's not randomness, that's as close as you can get to real life simulation! I love these devs!

The DevelopersSpeaking of the devs, they are great and they know what they're doing. They are active and constantly fixing the game and notifying about the server's status etc...


TL;DRIt's an awesome fishing game, with some suprising great little details. Try it, you won't regret it! No need for real life fishing experiences.

8.5/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I reviewed this title a while back, and while I didn't recommend it then I was too leniant on its cons as I really wanted the title to succeed, and I believed in the developers.
It is also a good looking title, and feels good in many ways.

I dont believe anymore, the developers are frustratingly similiar to politicians, they react to positive posts that are 'harmless' but completely ignore any serious questions, like ...

- Why is the drag setting so limited ? 7 Settings only (0 - 6) ?
- Why does heavier tackle struggle to cope with small fish ? A 0.7 kg smallmouth redlining a 9.1k line on a 10.5 kg reel on a heavy rod ? At half drag setting ?
- What EXACTLY does the message 'Fish tried to bite and escaped'  ? Specualtion is , hook size is wrong but that doesnt make sense as the same hook can catch a 5.1 kg striper and a 0.9 kg smallmouth , so what fish is struggling to take that hook ?

These questions could be easily answered and the whole debacle put away for good, but no answer.

There is also the unrealistic mechanics in place, like...

- Catching 'uniques' , you dont just fish away and have a 'whopper' take your bait... nope you check online videos or lists, or your own excel spreadsheets for 'proper timing and rigs' and fast forward time to the 'correct window' and for an in game hour or two you try catch 'uniques'. You cant be patiant as the time is ticking away, the window is small and the in game time is accellerated.

- The game gives you charts that show when the fish activity is at its highest, but that doesnt include 'uniques' , outside that particular window they are close for business utterly.

- The game has 2 types of in game stores to buy tackle and baits, the megastore that has everything but you cant use it when at a fishing location, you have to leave the location and then access the megastore, and the pay travel to return to your fishing location. There are store local to the fishing location but they make no sense, more often than not they will not stock the bait you need for that location (Wax Worms for Sunfish in Cali - not in the Cali shop).

- Hope you dont like catfish or panfish, they aint worth a damn according to this game, nope you need to catch bass, pike and Salmon for any decent exp and rewards.

- Physics are mess, the fish will be staring at the sky with thier tails facing the bottom yet pulling on your line while being dragged sideways while the fish is in a vertical posture. You will often need to drag fish through the ground, your rod will attempt to use ninja clone techniques while fishing (double rods) and your fisherman will often reveal that they are blue aliens when the skin colour 'washes' off.

Defenders of the title will pull out the old Early Access defence, yet  the title has 4 current DLC packs and has had 2 event DLC packs, 6 DLC packs since August, yet the title has numerous mechanical faults which have been brought up pre-early access during its close beta period, and not addressed.

Looks good, feels good but is not a very good simulator. the more time you invest the harder it gets to ignore the cracks but the developers seem to be staring at stars if you look at their 'roadmap' ... cars, boats, houses, worldwide locations, customisable avatars... they havent even got the basics down yet, nor even added features that should of been in place long ago like quests and tournaments.

It is the better fishing sim, but in a rather limited race and with very poor competitors its hardly much of a endorsement.
Try it out but dont expect much in terms of simulation... its a casual feels good looks good arcade game, with some bare minimal simulation.

Early Access Review

Okay.
This game is the most fun I've had in any fishing game so far.
Seems like there is a fair bit of expansion to be had, and I'm thrilled everytime I have a bobber drop.
Don't get me wrong. This is a bit of a waiting game, but fishing is about either finding fish or lucking up to hit that 10% of the water that fish reside in.
Did I mention there are fish in this game, and you can CATCH them!?
Great attention to detail as well. The black crappie I just caught looks like one I just caught last weekend.


Edit as of 9/16/15
This game is so relaxing I've started using it as a sleepaid at night. Its almost as peaceful as camping in real life, I just wish there was a volume mixer that was more than just music, and effects.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I love fishing, I live in FL and fish all the time.  I've been dying for a fishing game that's worth anything since sega dreamcast was around.   I want this title to do well, this game has all the right ideas, all the things I would want in a fishing game.   Since it is early access I won't harp on game mechanics and physics as I know they will improve.  My biggest problem with the game is its just not fun.  Let me explain, in Fl in real life I go to a lake I can catch many species using the same bait by adjusting I how I present it to the fish, where I'm from bass,bluegill,catfish,etc,etc will eat a nightcrawler.  It may not be optimal but it happens.  In this game its not like that at all, I find myself searching guides after frustration sets in.  You then find to catch this species you cast in this exact spot, during this time period, with exact leader setting at this amount, using this exact lure or bait and then grind for hours using that exact setup.  There isn't really any rng.  Once you get the xp needed to reach next lake you then go to guides find exact spot and grind for hours on the next fish.  To me thats not fun.

If you don't like grinding you can spend 150$+ of real money to get the better lures, and xp boosts.   I probably don't play this game mostly because of the costly dlc that comes out that you need to buy if you don't want to play for 12 hours a day to compete with others.   The very first day this game came to steam I spent 20$ for a weekly boost of some sort and it does not go by game time it goes by real time so it forces you to play alot to make it feel its worth it purchase.   I would rather this game be 40$ and come with all content then claim to be free to play.   Its free to play to get you in the door then when you feel the grind you pay out the A##.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is in ALPHA and yes there are tons of things wrong as far as bugs go but is is playable..

After 60+ hrs in game I have to say it is a  SIM that has the normal grind for gear like all games do. With that said it is FREE TO PLAY (so why not play it?).

IMO it's FTW=FREE TO WIN cause you can buy everything in the game with ingame cash that you get by playing!

!!NO PAY TO WIN!! yeah sure you can get a prem account but that only gives a xp advantage.

As for graphics is really polished and looks great! Sound gets abit dull and boring at times but its ok.

So in the end is it worth playing yes for me anyways cause I am a fisherman and I know this is just a game and not real life..

I give it a 10/10

download it see what you think foryour self

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Developers have torpedoed their own boat with this last update.
Great game until then - now you are doing well if you get your fishing gear to the bank side before it breaks!
Still you can always pay to fix .... no thank you!

Updated 18/04/2016:
Everything in this game, be it licences, travel costs, gear that doesn't work properly or breaks unrealistically, most effective baits,  slow xp grinding levels, ( AND prohibited fish you can't shake" off your hook .... see below)
date: is now designed to get you to buy more in game currency/premium time for more real cash and that's a step too far for a lot of regular players.\n\nIt's particularly relevant and a big disappointment to those players who had previously supported the developers in buying premium accounts and earlier DLC packages that are now effectively broken and useless in game.  Despite the hours I've clocked up
recommended:
I can't recommend this game in it's current state..... it's unrealistic and more importantly it's no longer fun.

This was a very nice game prior to the last update but I've decided I can't justify throwing any more of my cash at "♥♥♥♥ Turpin" style developers who don't really give a toss about the playing community.

I added up my previous purchases of Premium Time/DLC (which I hasten to add
hoursPlayed:
I had no qualms in buying to fully enjoy all aspects of the game at the time) and it totalled £137.66p.
I happen to think that's more than enough "support" for any early access game and I'm walking away from the game now to cut my losses.

The latest DLC package alone costs more than the majority of full games on Steam and that's just ridiculous for a few bits of virtual tackle.

I'll go further and state that there is no way that this game should be flagged up as Early Access on the store page.  This game was a polished product (it isn't after the last major update)  being kept in early access by the developers to give them "free reign" to take more money from the players and allow them to change anything they want (even if unpopular with players) whenever they want.

This is effectively denying the community of any input at all as to how they would like to see the game go forward.

Fishing Planet in my opinion
voteText: could be fixed by simply selling it for a one time buy price
helpfulPercent: include options in game to adjust difficulty as required
votesHelpful:
and support it with regular free updates.  Unfortunately the developers currently appear to be more interested in creating a "cash cow" and taking the players for everything they can get.

I've attached an example below to show how desperate the developers are now getting to take your hard earned in-game cash off you.  This was a response to a player who respectfully asked why he was still fined in game bucks after releasing a prohibited fish he had accidently pulled in. reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI have found heaven. Its a virtual fishing bank where the beer is always cold, the bugs never bite and there are no fish & game wardens. reviewText:
Early Access Review

..:: HONEST REVIEW - NO BS AND A** KISSING ::..
NOTE: Since this game is in EA this review will change with time (or not if developer keeps breaking his own game).

MyScore: 4+

Gameplay: 6+/10
Graphic: 5/10
Audio: 6/10
Developer: 3/10
Pros:
- currently best fishing simulator on the market***
- many fishing locations, fishes, baits, gear, etc.
- sometimes can be fun,

*** - best in genre doesn't mean good in general...


CONS:
- Since update 0.3.0 game is just unrealistic to the point where stuff breaks when it shouldn't or doesn't work like it should. Update brings a lot of nonsense to almost all parts of the game ultimately gimping gear, fishing mechanic and fish AI.

- Update 0.3.7 doesn't fix anything (durability system is still broken/gimped, values for gear strength are messed up and so on...) and brings even more issues with bucket full of boring content. There is nothing more anticlimactic than small pond (which they call a lake haha) filled with pretty much same small fishes which are on starting location in this game.

- Developer bans people for bringing up negatives about the game on the forum. They keep ignoring any negative opinions even when opinion is supported by loads of valid arguments and facts. Basically if you have negative opinion and you want to share it on the forum TO HELP THEM UNDESTAND WHAT IS WRONG WITH THE GAME YOU ARE VIEWED AS HATER.
It doesn't matter how many facts and valid arguments is behind you .. you still are treated as hater whos supposedly" attacking developer and they will remove you from forum.
It's pretty much gaming version of "Amy's Baking Company" from Kitchen Nightmares.

- Their Early Access statement is just one big pile of bs:
"...our team is aiming to deliver the most realistic and fun sportfishing experience..."
"...Our main priority is to ensure uncompromised realism of the fishing experience..."
Update 0.3.0 is putting this statement to the grave.

"we intend to use Early Access to polish everything out by fixing any bugs and introducing new features with the help of your feedback"
They not only not polishing things they IGNORE feedback and push low quality/broken content while adding new DLC for 30-45 euro. Greed at it's finest....

"...should take us approximately four months
date: with a full release planned for November 2015."\nThey claimed to have game polished in around 4 months... it's been 10 MONTHS and they not only didn't polished anything they also are nowhere near releasing this game. Game in current state is all over the place with bugs
recommended:
gimped mechanics and psychics. Just mess...

- Moderator deleting video evidence of game breaking bugs on the forum. Gives false excuses saying that my line broke becasue it was at 0% when in video clearly is on 94% and keeps talking about me not using "pro" meters which would show that my line is at low % which is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t becasue its irrelevant what meter i use. The point is that small fish broke heavy line and it shouldn't happen so they want to hide it by deleting any evidence.
Game is broken and it's reflected in 0.8kg fish breaking 3.6kg (and even 4.5kg) braided line like it's made of paper.
Evidence: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eDkBkwxkeeo

- Most of positive reviews is bogus and there are even threads on the forum calling people up to deal with negative comments. I guess they want to do everything to boost dying game.

- Developer which doesn't understand how bad his development strategy is:
FP lost most of initial player base and after 0.3.0 even more ppl just left.

- Developer making fishing game doesn't understand how fishing gear and physics works.

- Another developer abusing Early Access

Game server is located in NA so Europe and rest of the world is screwed by over 130ms ping causing game to lag

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm hooked.

All puns aside, I downloaded this thinking I'd delete it very quickly. However I started playing and that changed drastically.
Not only is this in-depth (although I don't know much about fishing), but it's easily accessible and personally I find it very fun to play. It isn't an action packed game, but get the right techniques and you get rewarded for it. Reeling in big fish is an exciting struggle and you do actually feel good when you land it.
It does have microtransactions, but if you play the game well, you aren't forced to use them, it encourages smart playing and research, which I find to be quite interesting.
It won't be everyone's cup of tea, but it's free; so download it and give it a try, you may be pleasantly surprised! I know I'm excited to play this tomorrow.
voteText: 26 of 30 people (87%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Best fishing simulator/game I ever played.

You can play for free no problem, it just takes you a bit longer to reach your goals.

Whenever I'm in the mood for fishing, but weather is too bad, season is just wrong, or health prevents me from doing it IRL, I can just get on here. Add a great community to that, and I got all I need.

Is it good? I think so. 343 hours logged and about to add more.

Are you a person that needs something to happen every second in your life? Then this is probably not something for you.  This is a simulator, not a fish-reeling game.

But if you want to relax, join us with a rod and reel by the shores, and perhaps come on teamspeak as well for a good chat, and if needed, some help.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo I played this game for probably more hours in a couple of months than a couple of games I have owned for a year or two and I can tell you that alot of this time was fun. Until you get to the grind. If you are looking for a fishing simulator I would honestly wait for maybe a year and see where this game is in that time. Fishing isnt about catching and I dont believe the devs and many people actually realise this, its about the thrill of catching the fish, the fight and the thought that you have the chance to not catch anything or catch a fish that you can put in your personal records or the local newspaper. I am level 17 in this game right now and have caught hundreds of fish, If I was on a trawler boat sure I would accept that number but once you are grinding from what I have gathered 313 fish to get 25000 xp for level 18 to get to a new lake and actually catch some decent fish is rediculous, the process of getting this 25000 xp is pretty grueling requiring you to constantly fish the same old bass in the same old spot at the same old time with the same old lure with no real skill involved (promised dynamic fishing system not implemented). So the only way to get this XP is through Farming" call it what you want this is not fishing its catching
date: when it gets to the point you are catching a fish every cast every day on the same lure it is catching
recommended: after a while this is no longer fun. When discussing this I have had the typical "well go fish somewhere else" "stop calling it farming and you will eventually stop thinking it is a grind". I am sorry but since I spent nearly a month in each of these spots "farming" it is boring and also ineficient as the lower level places give you less XP as you expect. Sure its a fishing game but not a simulation game like advertised which is sad to me. I thought the game would be fun and exciting after the new fish fights

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Imagine your standing in the middle of a town with a fishing rod... theres a barrel 80 yards in front of you with fish in it.

If you cast at it and land your lure in the barrel, you get a fish! if you cast and miss the barrel, no fish!

Allright now change the backdrop into a forest sceen next to a lake and disguise the barrel with camouflage.

BAM you have just recreated fishing planet mechanics.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok so this is my first Steam game review. This game is so good I am spending part of my Fishing Planet time to write this.
I love everything about this game except one thing, which i will get to.

First the pros:

1. The amount of details the developers put into this game is unreal. Every fish species has its habitat you have to fish for it in just as in real life and the habitats are true to life. Even the action of the lure you are using is a big factor just like real life. Same with the bait. Just like fishing in real life combine all those factors and execute your cast and retreival properly and you may have a chance at the fish your hoping for. Odd are though, that it will be just another Bluegill.

2. For an early access game, in my experience this has the least amount of bugs, personally I haven't experienced any.That being said I have heard in game that others have been experiencing visual glitches. As for game mechanics, i have heard nothing.

3. The graphics are quite decent and doesn't bog my graphics card down much, if at all, and im running max settings on an old NVIDIA GeForce GTX 460. The water looks good, pretty realisic. The only thing i would say is add a little more such as the occasional fish jump and more to the fishing gear section such as sunglasses. So if your wearing polarized shades you can see past the glare and be able to see the fish underwater. I know that would be a lot to add but it would just improve the overal appeal of the game and add to the realism of the fishing in this game.

The only con is the license system. Now i know this game revolves around realism but come on, the only thing worse than buying a license to fish in real life is buying one in a game. Every. Time. You. Go. On. A. Fishing. Trip. Unless you wanna spend an absurd amount of in game money for several months worth of fishing.
Here's the thing, I live in Upstate New York, The We'll Charge You For Everything Except Taking A Shi%, Oh Wait We Charge For That Too State. and i only have to buy one once a year. And only for a measly 20 bucks at WalMart. I am just glad they don't make you pay real life money for in game licenses, or else i wouldn't play. But catching fish doesnt earn that much money especially when fishing trips in game are ridiculously expensive coupled with expensive fishing licenses. But if i wanted to not be able to afford to go on a fishing trip i would just shut off my computer and sit at my desk and not go on a fishing trip. Lower the prices of travel and licenses, but if you want to keep the prices so expensive have the fish earn more money seeing as that is your only source of income.

Other than that i love this game and i would recommend it to anyone and everyone. I know some random guy's rating doesnt matter much but ill give it a 9/10, and if the income and/or prices change for the better ill change it to 10/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The best fishing sim I've played. Not perfect, but absolutely better than the competition.

Pros:
Immensely diverse range of tackle, gear and baits. This is kind of a double edged sword as the depth of options makes for a steep learning curve; selecting the right gear for the right species is problematic, especially for starting  players. One needs only to take note of the subject matter within the in game chat channel--this almost invariably consists of players asking 'which hook/leader length/area do I need to catch X fish'. That said, I don't think the brevity of tackle options should be considered a negative. This balanced a little bit by the number of guides and info videos available online--most of what you need to learn can be gathered pretty handily outside of the game.

There is a wide vvariety of fish to taget and while most do share similar rig preferences, there's still enough nuance required in order to land trophy and unique specimens which makes for good challenges.Calender events serve as a way for players to catch fantasy fish which are worth fair amounts of in-game currency, which can be used to purchase the best gear and baits. Nothing is locked behind a paywall, although special offers do come along seasonally which gives people the option to purchase extremely high end gear at lower levels--in this sense, the game is technically pay to win. Fighting fish is a fun, and unlike Euro Fishing, the physics which govern these are intuitive and intelligible;  striking, reeling and lure retrieval mechanics are all well concieved  and work consistently, and solidly. The graphics are pretty good for an in dev game, ambient noise is realistic, and the locales are pretty enough to look at.

Cons:
Perhaps ironically, Fishing Planet is possibly too realistic. Missed strikes, incorrect rig, lure and bait choices can result in lots of time spent winding or watching a float bob for no result. It pays to do your  research before heading out. It is also quite grindy; levelling is slow especially in the teens, and this is exacerbated by the fact that gear access is level restricted. In order to catch fish which yield worthwhile cash and experience  relative to your level, you often find yourself needing gear you can't access. The result is that you wind up grinding out fish which are no challenge to catch, and yield little rewards and experience.It's a bit off kilter and hopefully the devs correct this in the future as this is probably the biggest, and most monotonous flaw in the game.

As far as I can tell, unique and trophy fish seem to drop at inconsistent rates depending on the species. Trophy catfish in the starting area are common, yet you can expect to reel in dozens of bass before landing a trophy specimen. Post patch, alligator gar have become impossibly rare, whereas unique redear sunfish are caught hand over fist. It's a broekn system which requires an overhaul.

Overall, and  considering that Fishing Planet is pre-release, it's definitely well worth playing. The foundations for something great are all there, It just needs some refinement. And there's enough to keep you interested in the interim.

Score: 6/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Still hold out hope they can get things back on track but with each update it seems less and less likely. Before update 0.3.0 back in March this was without a doubt my favorite game and I played it any time I had a bit of free time to do so.

After the update though the new fishing mechanics were/still are so unrealistic it’s more frustrating than it is fun. You’ll literally fight a fish for hours in game and hope that after all that work that this 5lb fish doesn’t completely spool your 30lb line in the end like it’s a shark or whale. I’d hoped they would fix this and kind of bring down to the level at which it was before the patch but so far we’ve still got these fish that are obviously on steroids.

Never in my life have I broke a rod or reel. While they have slightly fixed this issue they still break way too easy in the game, I think we may be using glass rods and reels. They also made all gear wear out so now you need to repair everything pretty much constantly, which eats a good chunk of the profit you earn.  The only logic I see here is they wanted people to have to purchase more in game currency as before you could play the game 100% free (buying a membership grants you 50% increased experience so I always had a membership for the boost and to help support the game) with no issues. You still can but the less experienced/new players really seem to struggle now.

Two good things that came in the patch were the gear matching (however the way it’s setup means that having max rod slots is all but mandatory to avoid constant gear swapping) and they fixed the right mouse button spam that plagued the game. To be completely honest I wish they would have just fixed the right mouse button spamming and left the reset of the fishing mechanics alone as they were fine.

In the end it’s probably still the best fishing game out there however the player base has really dropped off in a short amount of time. I’ll keep hoping they bring the game back to its former glory but as for now I’ve all but completely stopped and I wont recommend the game in it's current state as the fun factor just isn't there anymore like it was before the big update.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fishing planet is the ultimate relax experience. Moreover, despite being F2P is not by any means P2W and not repulsive in graphic/simple stupid gameplay terms.

In fact, graphic is nice and close to imitate realistic pond and everything you can find around it- logs, plants, boats etc. Audio is calm and minimalistic. Besides intro music (which is great) there are only sound effects which is actually a great decision as it fulfills the calm and silent atmosphere of fishing contemplation. Birds, water and mosquitos are the perfect background to sit back and chill out.

As for gamplay it is really more complex than throw and tow. You get yourself into two main ways of fishing- spinning and angling. Spinning is where you go for the fighters and predators. You must master several techniques of spinning as different predators respond differently to given bait and its movement.

When you get tired of fighting you can take out your angler and do some peaceful casting for some less fierce fish. There you have to know what given fish likes to eat the most, where they hide and at which depths.

There is a lot to learn and fishing blind and random will result in small blue basses. When you do your research and come prepared, you will get comparable results with big largemouth basses and heavy catfish as there is very little randomness in this game. If you know what you are doing you will get results making it very high commitment-high reward game. It will never make you feel you lost your time, even when you pour many hours into it.

I covered barely some of the aspects of the first fishing place, there are more really challenging lakes as well as more types of fish to catch. Although being still in early access, game provides countless hours of fun and relax and there is lots of competitive stuff planned for the future.

Moreover its free, so you can try it out with no money loss. Although when you try it, you will feel that the devs deserved some monetary gratitude for their tremendous work that is far superior to good ol' Trophy Bass series in every aspect.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Other than the small crash issues at the loadinga and quiting, I really wanted to enjoy this game. To summarize my short opinion of it so far:

Pro's:

- Brilliant Scenery!
- Starts off slow, you'll need to have the patience to get to the Intense fishing before you really start to enjoy it, so hang in there!
- Relaxing Music and feel to the game

Con's:

- Limited movement space, the player has very limited space to move, which is surprising with the amount of places down the river. To move to a new spot, your basically having to do a 2 or 3 second load to that spot. Overall, there was not much point in adding Character movement.

I was hoping for a bit more freedom in movement and allowing the player to explore the scenery beyond.

- Crashing at the fist Loading Screen, Note: Don't Click or press anything whilst on the loading screen, If you get the Please wait pop-up. Then click please wait and it should eventually load.
- Crashing on Quit..

The crashes will obviously get fixed eventually though. :)

Now they can remove the bait off your hook without causing a disturbance to your float, when you do manage to hook one they race off to the weed beds and wrap your line around the weeds which snares your equipment, leaving you to try and rescue your equipment while the fish saunters off giving you the preverbial 2's up. Let's be real Devs....fish are thick, don't give them something they never had in the first place
Now your equipment deteriorates at an alarming rate...how can throwing nylon line into fresh water once knock 1% off it's durability, salt water possibly...maybe. I assume the reason why they have now changed players equipment to be made of tissue paper is so that people will spend more of their hard earned in game cash, which now is even harder to get as you can't catch fish to sell.
Well done Devs you have done what all other failed computer game creators have done, listened to a very minor group of annorak players and broke the cardinal rule, DONT TRY AND FIX WHAT IS NOT BROKEN !!
Due to this recent patch you have lost alot of players, maybe you will see the errors of your ways and change things back making this enjoyable and playable again,if not then I wish you well in the pits of obscuredom which is now where this is heading.

Early Access Review

As far as a fishing game goes, the game" outweighs the "fishing" portion by a large margin. It seems to be all about slowly building up your gear with incremental upgrades at prices and stats that are set with only competetive balance in mind.

The gameplay itself is very simplistic and doesn't feel very natural. There is no walking around a lake or getting in a boat- you pick one of two or three spots on the map and you'll be teleported to that particular ten square feet of shoreline where you can clumsily sprint to the water's edge and begin "fishing."

It's never difficult to tell what the developers are focusing on in a game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Being a lover of fishing I thought that I would give this free game a go and I have now racked up  140 hours so far. I like the game a lot and there are many friendly people online to chat with in game that share hints and tips on the best times to fish.

It can take a long time to level up if you do not have premium membership but that is part of the challenge and as you level up this unlocks better tackle in the shop for purchase so one day you can land that dream fish.

The game also contains two types of currency; gold which is harder to come by but is earned by unlocking achievements or catching unique fish and silver which is the main in game currency which is earned from catching the remaining fish types plus also unlocking certain achievements.

If you download this game and your a fishing lover you won't be disappointed. Tight Lines.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I do want to go into to much detail why this game is good. just read this and download and you will see why!

PREMIUM ACCOUNTS, PURCHASES AND F2P
Are premium accounts obligatory to play the game at some stage?
No
Premium accounts as all the other things you can purchase for real money are absolutely optional.
You can play through the game without paying any real money. You will get anywhere and will catch all the fish there's available in our game.

What do I get from premium accounts?

With Premium account you get a 50% boost in experience you get per each caught fish for the duration of the account, a pack of licenses,a money pack.

In simple words premium account just lets you level up faster.

Is there any specific tackle or content I can purchase only for real money?
No.
Infact, quite contrary, there content you can unlock only by playing the game.

So, do you have a membership?
No.
Premium accounts are more like boosters. And are optional.

that right premium are optional so yes the game is free! fish while you earn.

Sorry DTG Fishing step aside there a new king in town!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

With almost a full day of gameplay I want to start a first impression review for people both in the know how for fishing and new to fishing games (like me. Yep, I'm a CSGO/Team Fortress player, not a simulator/fishing player. BUT I've fished in my life time):

Pros:
This is the first game in a long time that has had me hooked" extensively. The gameplay is fluid and accurate. Stepping into the game I was expecting 1 of 2 things: Confusing and unnecessary game mechanics OR pay for the "best" equiptment as do MANY other fishing simulators contain.

Starting and Controls:
BOY WAS I WRONG. Off the bat the tutorial gives you the need to know basics for fishing in general which is easy to use and from experience really an amazing portrail of the sport in real life. After you understand the simple and relaxing controls you're off fishing on your own.

Gameplay:
USUALLY
date: games like this would start you off with fish in tiers (Example: Start bluegill
hoursPlayed: then bass
voteText: and so on). However
helpfulPercent: you're able to start going for either bluegill
votesHelpful: catfish
votesTotal: pike
votesFunny: or bass right off the bat. When it comes to fishing in this game
commentsCount:
real world knowledge is amazingly potent in this game. A HUGE plus over other fishing simulators! Catching a fish in this game gives a SUPER rewarding and that's why I'm enjoying every bit of the game play.

Market Model:
There are free to play games I play without spending a dime but are annoyingly hard and VERY long to progress through where I just get burnt out and stop playing. Then
column16: there are games where a majority of everything in the shop can be achieved... PURELY BY PLAYING!\n\nYou don't need to spend anything to achieve special currency. Yep
column17: "premium currency" is awarded through achievments and special fish. Yep
column18: just like the games of old

column20: you can completely farm up to get all the items in the DLCs just from playing.\n\nAlso
column21:
the in game currency is made fast with a bit of work BUT no where near grindy or slow as many other F2P models out there. This game's F2P model is a HUGE plus being a F2P player. Great job!!!

Cons:
Lack of Variety and Content:
One thing that slows you down is the fact that there's only so many fish you can catch. To many people this can bog down grinding and cause interest to droop off but it's what I expect from a game that just went into release. I know for a fact there's going to be A LOT more content to be added here such as tournaments
column24:
and more fish and equiptment.

Though on the plus side to this there are varients of the current fish you can catch and personally that's good enough for an on release game.

Grindy(ish):

this is in place so the level split between casual and hard core doesn't grow too far apart.

The low level grind is decent up until level 10 and then you feel the monotonous grind thereafter. Like I stated! They're changing this in a week so this will change for sure!

Entry Level Steep(ish):
If you have experience fishing or used to fish like me

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Free fishing game!  Thanks!

Great looking graphics
Lots of different fish to catch
Peaceful music and sounds

The game is peaceful and a time passer, the fish are pretty easy to catch.  Fishing Planet helped occupy my two year old for a few minutes while he helped me catch some fish.  I got bored pretty fast on this game and do not think I will be playing it without my son.

Edit:  I wanted to add that you can switch your tackle up, adjust drag, reel speed and bobber depth, travel to different fishing holes in a few states as you level up, travel to a couple different holes in each map, and adjust the time that you would like to be fishing.  Then once your there fishing you have very limited walking area allowing you to go from side to side on the shore for a short distance.

I'm giving this game a thumbs up for what it is, a free time passing fishing game.

EARLY ACCESS REVIEW

Pros:
Looks nice, graphics are fairly good
Has a more realistic look than most fishing games

Cons:
First and foremost the game has a misplaced focus on locating fish rather than the catching of them.
It can takes hours finding the right spot, time of day, right bait to find what your looking for and when you finally hook one, you can reel it in quickly without much trouble at all. The fish fight" aspect of the game  is virtually nonexistent.

The game claims to be "multiplayer" however is simply a single player instance with a chat box in the corner.

No customization at all

VERDICT:

I can't recommend the game at this time.

The developers I think are dropping the ball

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me star this off by saying I am one of those that is VERY lery of F2P games.

Its not that I have an issue with the sales model.....If done properly it works very well for some games. But thats where it all falls apart, because 9 times outta 10 it is NOT done properly. To many games say F2P but then hide huge amounts of content behind paywalls. To many say F2P but are actually P2W.......

And EVERYONE here Im sure know full well what I speak of....I could name games but would rather not....

That having been said......
This is a great game, and a GREAT F2P model. Even the DLC on steam is mostly stuff that you can get ingame playing without ever paying a cent (or there is comparable from what I saw).
I have not purchased any of the DLC yet but I plan to, seems a great way to stock up on role specific gear AND this honestly has potential to be best fishing sim ever..Im willing to throw some $$ at that!!!
I have purchased the 3 day premium account. Can say these packs or more than reasonably priced for what you get..and brilliant you can use your steam wallet for this!!
I did level to almost 4 before getting premium to get a feel for the game. Yes it is a bit slow...but its fishing, everything is a little slow ya =) It did not seem to slow or unfair or overly grindy at all.

Great game thats 100% playable with ZERO investment, but well worth every penny if you do decide to spend a bit.

All of the content in the game (different areas you fish) are capable of being unlocked by leveling and using in-game currency for players who choose not to spend money on the game.  An ideal way of doing the Item Mall.  Only thing I can see people having issues with it is when tournaments are unlocked and players who spend can get a certain lure a level early, but that's far from pay to win in my eyes.

- For the most part the community are more mature players.  But with any free-to-play game, you are going to see some immature idiots trying to ruin your experience.


Overall this game is pretty addicting, fun and requires patiences (it is fishing after all.)

Early Access Review

Absolutely the best fishing game ever!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

F2p done right here.

Even right now in early point of the Early Access, without much to do, other than grind experience and chat with other players at your fishing spot, this game truly shines brighter than the other fishing sims and games I have played so far.

So many rods and lures to choose from, with different kinds of lines and reels , its really the fishing game to try out.
Even at this point there are good amount of spots and a lots of different fish types to choose from.

I personally love the leveling system, and the unlocking of better equipment and clothes through ranking up while fishing. Cant wait for the tournaments, quests and duels which are coming on a later date into the game.
They will make the relaxing fish grinding even an better experience for us in the future.

And about the microtransactions.
This game definitely isn't another TheHunter, if you know what I mean. You can easily play and enjoy this game for full of its content for free and enjoy it as much as anyone. The ingame currency is easy to obtain and gets you the gear and licenses you need for the fishing spots without too much work (Or work at all, cause its fun to earn ingame currency while fishing and turning the fish in).

If you are interested in fishing or just fishing games, I cannot recommend this game highly enough for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The best fishing simulator in steam, at least for now.

Pros:
- Free 2 Play
- Realistic (kind of). You'll need basic knowledge about fishing to be good able to play and enjoy this game, every rod and reel feel different and you'll need to match it with certain line, certain bobber, certain hook, certain lure/bait, certain technique and certain time of the day to land certain fish successfully (don't forget to buy your fishing license or you'll be fined). So many varieties, at first you'll be overwhelmed by it.
- Fishing shop. You'll feel like browsing a real fishing shop website, although to buy something you need to meet the level requirement.

Cons
- Damage mechanism need more polishing, it's a bit unrealistic
- Certain items only available in a limited time DLC
- Need more contents (not really a con as it's still in early access)

9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros:
- The graphics for the tackle and other items are well done. When you buy items from the bait shop or pro shop it looks like you're actually purchasing a real item.
- The environment graphics aren't perfect but they are nice.
- The imposed limit of what you can buy when on a fishing trip is interesting. You are limited to buying small things like extra bait or line but if you need a better rod you have to cancel the trip. It makes planning crucial.

Cons:
- There are certain combinations of items to catch certain fish, and certain spots to catch them. There is very little variety other than the size, length, or quality (trophy or non-trophy) of the fish once you figure this out.
- Bugs and unrealistic physics. Sometimes when you cast you will just drop the line into the water at your feet. I was told by many other players that they experienced this bug. If you yank a fish out of the water sometimes it will send it into this ridiculous orbital spin where it goes sailing around your body. I ended up not having to struggle with fish anymore because I would yank them from the depths of the river and they would go flying into the sky and right up on the riverbank where I could just reel them in as they sat there.
- Two forms of currency. A lot of items in the game can only be bought with gold. You can earn it without any form of micro-transaction but it just doesn't make sense. When did you ever go into a Bass Pro shop and try to buy something with gold coins? These aren't always things like special rods or reels...they are consumables like grasshoppers...
- No weather effects.
- Poor day and night" cycle.
- There really is no multiplayer in this game. You fish by yourself and you can chat with other players but you never see them in-game.
-  Extremely limited by fishing locations. You can only travel the space of about 20 feet along a bank or dock to change where you fish. You won't be finding any secret fishing holes. Part of the fun of fishing is exploring and finding your own spot."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you want a fishing game this is the only one you need. People complaining about grinding? It's fishing, it's fun and it takes patience and getting to know what the fish like. You'll be able to start catching fish right away without that, but if you really want to be able to catch the a trophy or catch a unique fish then you'll need to do your homework.

The community is very friendly and willing to help you out regardless of your knowledge of the game and it's the first online community that has been able to elicited a smile during the hours of playing over the last few days. If you don't have a little patience or a little drive to try and figure the fish out then the game isn't for you. All the information is pretty easily available and there are plenty of guides on the steam forum and within the game itself if you ever get stuck. The gear choice is a little overwhelming at first, but you pick it up quickly.

So far a very promising game. There is a lot of potential here and the devs claim to have realism at the fore-front of their minds. Realistic game that will get you addicted quickly. Once these future updates come out this will be a game for veterans and players new to fishing alike.
It should be noted that there is a lot that needs to be tweaked, fixed, changed, added to and so on. This game is still Early Access and is only a small representation of what they are planning on doing with the game as updates start to roll out. Please be patient and check back often for updates.

It's too early to start listing pros and cons due to the amount of changes that will be taking place. Everyone has their own opinions, instead of reading what others think check it out for yourself. reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alright im gonna make this review quite short at the moment because i haven't really got that far into the game when i write this.

First and formost i gotta say.. Wow.. This game.. If you fish in real life and love it this game will pull you in and keep you playing! This is one of the most realistic and fun fishing games ive played in a LOOOOONG time. You actually gotta use real tactics, use the right lure/bait, right rod, line and depth. This is not some arcade game where you just throw out a lure or a bobber with some bait and just catch fish.. But that's the best part in my opinion :)


Many of you that has seen theHunter for example on steam might think oh is this one of those games where you have to pay real money for licenses (Yes there are licenses in this game but ALL of em can be bought with ingame cash even unlimited ones so you don't have to keep paying every time you wanna fish. And keep in mind if you buy a license for  example 1 day it will actually last for 24 in real life hours)

For now this is a wellcrafted

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros:
Most realistic fishing game to date.  Think The Hunter" but with a higher moisture content.
Very active Devs that listen to the community and actually seem passionate about fishing.
Wide range of fish from bluegills to bass to pike and everything between.  Muskies in the future.
Simple but effective casting/retrieving system

Cons:
Fish "hot spots" are all you need to know
date:
cast same area over and over again
Grind - you'll find yourself casting the same spot over and over landing fish over and over to level
Locations limited at this time

Most of those cons should be fixed once they add more locations and boats.  Being limited to a few shore spots at this time really causes a lot of repetition but once you can float around the lake that should make things much more interesting.

If you like fishing you will like this game.  If you don't like fishing you might find this game boring at its current build but in the near future things look to be really opening up.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a pretty fun fishing game.  Can be a bit grindy, but it's enjoyable and relaxing.  If you're looking for a chill experience in a game of skill, this one is for you.

Graphically it's pretty decent.  I don't have any issues with it on my machine, and find it faily bug free for the time being.  You get the odd lag spike every now and again, but other than that I haven't noticed anything game-breaking.

A few things I'd like to see:

Additional Weather Effects.  Rain would be a nice addition.  Wind would also be a good simulation addition to add to the challenge of placing your cast.

Better social aspects.  Friends lists would be cool.  A guild system (fishing clubs?).

A slighty improved interface for going over your equipment.  It'd be nice to easily compare items to one another on mouse-over...like a hover box when you look at something in your inventory to compare to what you have currently equipped.

That's my two cents for now.  Back to the water for me.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Newbie Review: Fishing Planet
Hello everyone! This is my first review ever for a game on Steam, and I do intend to get better at it as I continue reviewing my favorite games, so don't be too harsh on me, OK?

WARNING: A lot of text ahead! Please skip to TL;DR if you're not into this kind of reviews.
This game popped up on Steam, and my first thought was A Free-to-Play fishing MMO? What's that?". This game was free to download so I decided to give it a try. This game is in Early Access  so many features are absent at the moment but the core gameplay and the main mechanics of the game are absolutely clearly visible and I like them a great deal already. The game has a small but concise and precise tutorial
date: and a hint system was added recently so anyone new to the game in particular or to the genre as a whole will have a decent possibility to dive right in without any significant problems. In my first 30 minutes or so of gameplay
recommended: I realized that getting experience and unlocking new equipment was quite hard and similar to a grind of some kind
hoursPlayed: but the developers are constantly working on the game and they did improve the experience gain system
voteText: leveling up become easier even without a premium account (I hadn't put any money into this game up to this point and I think it won't be necessary at any point in the near future
helpfulPercent: and this I also like a great deal).\n\nThis game does require a little bit of fishing knowledge to get the full experience out of it. However
votesHelpful: this doesn't mean you have to be a fishing expert to play this game properly. I went fishing (IRL
votesTotal: I mean) a couple of times so I have some basic information about where to search for fish
votesFunny: what bait to use and so on. So
commentsCount: from a casual gamer and a newbie fisherman standpoint
column16: this game is quite easy to understand
column17: very chill and relaxing (awesome graphics and sound effects do get the work of chilling you out done quite nicely)
column18: and of course it is reasonably entertaining. As of the moment of this review being posted
column19: there are no multiplayer components in this game aside from the chat (which
column22: but it doesn't take a lot from the game in its current status.As of right now
column23: this is more of an enjoyable single-player fishing sim than an MMO
column24:
but the game is still quite good.

Controls in this game are quite intuitive and also there is a full key binding map available if you press F1 in-game.

I have very little to say about the negative aspects of this game
column25: but there are some nonetheless. First and foremost
column26: you have a limited amount of fish you can catch and carry away (in other words
column29: but there is no clear indication  on the interface itself of whether you have storage capacity left or not. You have to go to your inventory and check that from time to time. In my opinion
column30: it would be more comfortable to see your storage capacity indicated
column32: in the left hand bottom corner of the screen. The second  annoying thing in this game is that your hook may get stuck
column33: the popup says you can free the hook
column34: but out of 10 cases of being stuck I didn't manage to get my hook back. It's either an annoying bug or my hands just being not straight enough (which is indeed a possibility when it comes to gaming).\n\nNow
column36:
and get straight to the TL;DR Section

TL;DR
Pros:- awesome sound and graphics
- intuitive controls
- relaxing gameplay
- true F2P
column37:
very few premium items
- constant improvements in the game

Cons (those will hopefully get fixed)- no multiplayer just yet
- your hook often gets stuck and you have to cut the line most of the time
- no indication of spare storage capacity directly on the HUD
column38: it may be useful\n\nDo I recommend this game? If you are into fishing or fishing simulators and want to relax a little bit
column39: then give this game a try right now. You will need to play about 15 to 30 minutes after you have completed the tutorial to make your mind about this game in its current state. Bear in mind that it will get updated. And I also may need to update my review if the devs introduce some major changes (which they hopefully will).\n\nP.S. If you have time and desire to do so

Well i've put about 15 hours into this game.. and so far i've noticed a few things...

-The game is really fun not, very grindy.
-Has a great community and there are always players in game who will help you.
-And the best part is there are no pay to win elements to this game.
There are two currencies in the game, Cash and gold. cash is earned by catching any fish in the game and by completeing achievements, gold is earned by leveling up and catching trophies and unique fish!

This game gets a 10/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Highly recommended for people that has given up all hope in life and does not mind staring at a pointless computer screen for endless hours. Here's for all you good folks out there that has caught a fish, this amazing salmon recipe will help a lot with your future endeavours.

1 (2 pound) salmon fillet
1 teaspoon lemon-pepper seasoning
1 teaspoon onion salt
1 small onion, sliced and separated into rings
6 slices lemon
1/4 cup butter, cut into small chunks
1/3 cup sour cream
1/3 cup mayonnaise
1/4 cup dry white wine
1 tablespoon capers
1 tablespoon finely chopped onion
1 tablespoon caper brine
1 teaspoon lemon juice
1 teaspoon prepared horseradish
3/4 teaspoon dried dill weed
1/4 teaspoon garlic salt
ground black pepper to taste

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil; grease the foil lightly.

2. Place salmon fillet with skin side down on foil. Season salmon with lemon-pepper and onion salt; top with onion rings                   and lemon slices, dot with butter. Fold foil around salmon and seal tightly.

3. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes. Unseal the foil and turn the oven's broiler on. Continue cooking the salmon under the broiler until the flesh flakes easily with a fork, 8 to 12 minutes.

4. While the salmon bakes, stir sour cream, mayonnaise, white wine, capers, chopped onion, caper brine, lemon juice, horseradish, dill weed, garlic salt, and black pepper together in a bowl. Serve with the salmon.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fishing Planet is a New Free to Play realistic sportsfishing simulator made for anglers.  You will have to know how to fish for real and love fishing for real.   You can fish for 8 fish families.  The graphics look good but the background music is repetative.  You have a lot of control of how you set up your fishing gear and control on using your fishing gear.  Like real fishing, the environment conditions is supposed to effect the fishing.

You get for free 1 unlimited basic licence in Missouri, the Missouri map has 2 locations.  But you have invisible walls preventing you from moving away from the location or falling into water.  Looks like you can unlock other fishing trips after grinding through trips in Missouri, you have to level up and earn ingame credits.  There are 6 other fishing trips, currently locked.

If you buy a premium pack it gives you licences, give you some credits and a xp boost, and you can buy credit bundles with real money.  You can get licenses and gear using ingame credits.  You can earn some ingame credits and gold by playing.  If you go broke, game over, so make sure you make your trips profitable.  Maybe someone could learn how to fish for real playing this game well.


I don't like fishing, did only a little fishing when real young, so i am going by what i know watching fishing tv shows i seen.  It looked ok and game worked, has a beginning tutorial.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fishing Planet was a good romp for a while. The grind set in pretty hard after Colorado however. Even with recent XP bumps, there didn't seem to be any reason to visit the next area. North Carolina had more spots for snags, less XP, and generally less progression than Colorado. So you're faced with the prospect of grinding out three+ levels of trout instead of feeling like you're getting somewhere by moving on to the next area. I skipped the (somewhat miserable) New York area entirely after a couple of trial runs there.

But if you can ignore the grins and stick to the starter area and Colorado, you'll see what a beautiful, relaxing game it is. You can certainly kill some time and drink a few beers, maybe even kindle your interest in real life fishing. But unless there is vast improvement in the progression, don't let it become a major time sink. Just enjoy the good stuff, and hope the bad areas get better.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you like the old school fishing games you'll be in for a treat with this game. Keep in mind as of this review it is still a beta.

So far, I have made it up to level 4 and it has taken a bit of time, but being a fisherman myself in real life the leveling hasn't felt unrealistic.  Going out and not catching a fish for a period time can and does happen and while I can't sit down and play this game for a very long period of time I do find it enjoyable and even relaxing to a certain extent.

The game overall I can recommend, but if you come into it expecting a super-exciting fast-paced game this is not for you. If do however enjoy fishing and want a simulator that is fairly close to the experience give this a try I don't think you'll be disappointed.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Was sceptical when i heard theHunter team was involved. Entire game is actually free in this though.

Can unlock everything by playing and leveling (leveling is quite slow and tutorials ingame aren't too great, but the basics are covered).

Lots of locations, types of fish species, tackle and lures/baits to unlock (All can be unlocked for free by gaining xp and ingame money from fishing). Very fun for just messing around and a lot more content to come.

Licenses can be bought with ingame currency too this time unlike that collosal fail system that theHunter had where you could only hunt 1 species and have to pay real money for more. Would still like licenses done away with, but it does add a sense of realism. Can buy a keepnet quite early on which lets you release smaller fish to make space for bigger fish which will bring in more XP and money.

Travelling to different locations and fishing for however many days you want costs a certain amount of in-game currency - which can be made back with profit by catching fish throughout the trip. Bigger fish earn more xp and money

Lure fishing can be difficult at first but once you learn different retrieves ingame it gets easier

Game is very addicting and is easily the best fishing simulator game out there to date

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is probably the single most greatest achievement in my life. I have never played a more perfect game. To the way you cast, to the astmosphere, this game has it all. The world looks beautiful as I stand by the water casting my line, and then I get a bite! I reel it in a little, let it pull, and then pull it out of the water! I've never experienced anything like it before!

There is even a multiplayer part to the game! You can fish with all of your friends! As you all fish in the same area you can see what everyone else is catching around you! My friends and I all had a blast sitting here one rainy night, all fishing together. It was a great experience and I hope that everyone else comes and joins us too!

And if that wasn't enough to get you to get this game, then perhaps me saying that its free will get you to come and try it out! Plus the game is super easy to get into! Even those that don't like fishing can simply walk around the beautifullly constructed world.

I can't wait to see you all down by the pond!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fishing Planet is a fishing simulation sport game, where you play as a fisher and buying licenses to different regions and catching different fishes, either SP, MP or co-op cross platforms.

First of all, the game spare you the smell of fish, and secondly you get the game for free. The game offers a perfect overview of a fishing experience while thinking about life. The game starts to throw you through a tortorial, how to fish, what kind of bait to use and many other advanced fishing techniques.

You will have a inventory as player, where you can move around the fishing spots or travel by plane to find and catch better fish at better locations. You have the option to change time according to best time of catching fishes etc. When you catch a fish you can either release it or keep it to gain a reward. The reward is being used to buy better bait and other equipment. You do have a option to buy ingame cash for real time money, to get better equipment to catch better and bigger fishes.

For a free game, with a bunch of DLC's, the game offers a great fishing simulation sport game for those who loves fishing or wishes to learn about it. So if you are sitting with a fisher feeling in your stomach and want to learn something or relax in your home and run away from the fish smell, then this game is for you.

Here is a demo:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KOB5b1ImFn8

reviewText:
Early Access Review

this game is not broken its far better than it was back in august and it will only get better

now im not saying its perfect cos its far from that there is a lot of bugs about atm theres dissapeering fish,flying fish even raining fish :D theres a problem with the drag on a few real big fish,theres walking fish.
the wear system is fine if you keep your gear in the green area there is hardly any wear but if you go for bigger fish and have to go in the red then repair is more(nothing wrong with that)
but even with all these negatives the game is more fun than ever once you relearn it
fish fights are awsome now,the fish ai is a lot better(they actualy react to how you move the rod ect)i think the main problem is its no more easyland the biger fish take a lot more effort to land and i love that.
Even the smaller fish are far better now, go grab a ultra light setup 0.8 braid and a nano spinner and go origon i dare you to say its not funn :D to me is seems to many focus on the monster fish in game put town your big guns and go have some fun with the smaller stuff forget about xp grindin and start actualy fishing :D
any 1 that actualy knows me knows i spend more time at the lower lvl places than i do at the good places and im lvl 23.
Theres going to be lots more bugs,lots more changes before this game gets out of early access and i will be here for all of them becouse i love the game and realy enjoy it.
you can call me a fanboy i dont realy give a toss im in for the long haul,i will be here throu all the good times and the bad becouse this is a fantastic game a great dev team(a bit slow but hey there not a big team) and a fantastic comunity.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

i can understand that this game is a free 2 play. but the progression is extremly slow.
i watched a few youtube videos about how to catch specific fish and what not.
and ye they give you more than +1 star (aka exp.) but still it takes you forever to level up to level 3.

i am sure, with the premium (booster) thing, it wouldnt go alot faster.
also i can understand that the progression in this game is slower cause it may take you up to 10-15 or even more minutes till u actually catch a fish.
but even if i get a punch of 1.6 pounds -catfishes (+7 stars) it still takes quiet a long time to level up.


it wouldnt be a big deal if u would get a new map/location if u level to level 3 since it takes you atleast 1-2h to get to level 3, if u are new and got no idea what u are doing.
but no, (not completly sure) u need level 6 to get the second location, which is new york.

other than the really slow progression, the game is really sweet. fun and addicting!
i would love to see other players around the river fishing aswell. currently all you can do is chat with ppl on your server. thats not how an MMO works :(

also running around more would be really fun aswell, dont give us just a few spawns and we can walk 2meters to the water and stay there the whole day.

u should be able to only choose one spawn, which will be next to your car and than u can walk 10-20sec to the river (shortest way) or you can walk all around the river and fish from the other side :D

dont get me wrong, i dont want a walking simulator, just more possibilitys on where i can fish rather than a hardcoded" area.

looking forward for updates :)"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Eurotruck Fishing
So after tackling few days with the infinite loading screen and getting a helpfull tip to turn off my firewall, i decided to try and add the game to my Allowed list and it worked! so i was finally able to get ingame.

Now i been playing few fishing games here and there since the 90s and i quite weirdly enjoy random fishing game moments and was hoping Fishing planet" would give me an good experience and it sure did

Good:
+ Fancy graphics (The game sure is an eyecandy)
+ Crazy selection of equipment (i was blown away how much fishing stuff you can buy from lures to rods to hooks... it clearly shows the developers passion to fishing)
+ Relaxin (its oddly nice to just sit on a pier and wait for the fish to start nippling on your baits)

Bad:
-No music during gameplay (this really isint a downside since the natural sounds of birds is kind of relaxing but i would hope in the future there would be a choise for somekind of FM radio to listen random songs and/or proadcasts while spending quality time on fishing)

For anyone that is looking for fishing game or just to relax and spend time i can highly recommend this."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

i can understand that this game is a free 2 play. but the progression is extremly slow.
i watched a few youtube videos about how to catch specific fish and what not.
and ye they give you more than +1 star (aka exp.) but still it takes you forever to level up to level 3.

i am sure, with the premium (booster) thing, it wouldnt go alot faster.
also i can understand that the progression in this game is slower cause it may take you up to 10-15 or even more minutes till u actually catch a fish.
but even if i get a punch of 1.6 pounds -catfishes (+7 stars) it still takes quiet a long time to level up.


it wouldnt be a big deal if u would get a new map/location if u level to level 3 since it takes you atleast 1-2h to get to level 3, if u are new and got no idea what u are doing.
but no, (not completly sure) u need level 6 to get the second location, which is new york.

other than the really slow progression, the game is really sweet. fun and addicting!
i would love to see other players around the river fishing aswell. currently all you can do is chat with ppl on your server. thats not how an MMO works :(

also running around more would be really fun aswell, dont give us just a few spawns and we can walk 2meters to the water and stay there the whole day.

u should be able to only choose one spawn, which will be next to your car and than u can walk 10-20sec to the river (shortest way) or you can walk all around the river and fish from the other side :D

dont get me wrong, i dont want a walking simulator, just more possibilitys on where i can fish rather than a hardcoded" area.

looking forward for updates :)"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

While the beginning is pretty boring what with catching Bluegills and all, it's worth it to get to level three so you can start using lures.  Bass and Catfish are possible at level 2, but you'll probably catch more Bluegills than anything.  Once you get some spoons and jigs, the real fun begins and levelling goes much faster from there.  I sat down with a six pack of beer and before I knew it a couple hours had passed and I was out of beer.

I like that the game tries to teach you proper fishing techniques, which you can then apply to real world fishing.  I've learned a few things and will try them out next time I get on a boat because shore fishing in my area is pretty poor.  Overall it's a great game with lots of potential.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI've played this game a lot in the time I've had it. I really recommend it if you like fishing and know how to fish because real life tactics are applied here. The community is great and the game is progressing nicely so far. The only downfall at the moment is it is a bit of a grind fest, but the devs are working hard to tweak and adjust things to make the game more enjoyable while creating new content at the same time. 10/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

3/5
lots of potential . but misses the mark in keeping you motivated to play or spend money to see more.
pros.
Good physics
good depth of choice
graphics are decent
good variety of fish species
Lots of potential
cons..
just bank fishing, so very limited play style or variety
hard to figure out how to setup rods
You are mainly just bobber fishing
casting is very basic. point and click . no casting motions
pay to win. most stuff can be purchased instead of earned
everything cost money:: time on water, changing locations, purchasing baits after they snag etc
not much incentive to purchase store items because most stuff is locked out

Hopefully with more development time and less focus on pay to win it will live up to the potential because it is an awesome begining

Before I tell you what I think about this game you need take under consideration is this is a game in early stages still not near the finish product they want good constructive criticism help better the gameplay. They want you test it out give them constructive criticism before the finished product out that all said theres still alot ahead to make it a great game but it is on the correct path for that. The players vary from good helpful to a few bad eggs for advice like any game but asking is good do your research when testing this game youtube videos of catching fish one great way for a base line of fishing at a lake.

When this game finally is a what the staff they generally want as a finished product they won't stop they will continue make a great game for this they need support for players with constructive criticism as one means. That all said everything in the game is so lifelike fishing wise theres a few minor bugs but theres not a single game out there with them. If you want the most realistic fishing game with huge potential try Fishing Planet.  If you need help ask me tommyangelo
Enjoy

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is pretty realistic in terms of fishing mechanics and bait types. The graphics have the potential to be incredible if your computer can handle it. I have a Nvidia Gtx 960 superclocked and it runs the graphics on the best settings pretty well, but obviously if you lower the graphics settings it will run at a higher framerate. It can be a little bit of a grind sometimes to get the higher level items, but it still is fun. Since it is a free game there are micro-transactions, but they are not in your face about it and you can easily play the game without them. If you like fishing you will definitly like this game. If I had to give it a rating I would give it a 8/10 since it is a free game with great graphics and good gameplay.
