reviewText:
Early Access Review

I once caught a Catfish with just a string, a hook and a bait. So I always wanted to somehow find a Fishing game that's just as simple and realistic as it is.

So I played this game. Let's just say in a nutshell:

> Catches fish using non F11
> Feels like worst fishing casting method ever....
> Asks silent fishermen in the area.(You can't see them around but they are fishing invisible to you actually).
> Random fisherman tells me to press F11.
> F11 allows me to throw max or control where I throw the bait/lure to.
> Was grateful as f**k because game turned to Game Of The Year Edition for Fishing.
> Then asked where to fish other kind of fish(Since I always got nub fish)
> Random Fisherman told me step by step on how.
> So I followed and I got my 1st catfish by using just Bread.

>After getting a 3.4lb Catfish, I (Accidentally) bragged I can't keep it, since its too big for my fish keeping tool. Random Fisherman says, 'Nevermind, still nice catch!' Laughed Internally"

> Later on
date: suddenly we talked about MLG Fishing while waiting for my bait to get bite. We talked about 360noaimcasting 2ez and I actually tried 360 casting like a pro and got a fish from it(took some time still).\n\n>LATER ON
recommended: We talked about DLC in a good way. Someone suggested if they can have a radio
hoursPlayed: but there's already Steam Music Player lol. I recommend an announcer DLC where if someone is fishing something big they'll go announce it like how a sports announcer does in an exaggerated way. However other people suggests even more ridiculous DLC ideas.\n\nWell.....what can I say? It's a simple

Early Access Review

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This fishing simulator is great. Truly free to play, realistic, and has a great community.

Once you grind to level 3 the experience really begins as you can start to fish bass which is a great start on your way to trout in Colorado. Many of the new players say it is hard to level up and get money. I would agree, until level 3 I was struggling to break even but once you read the wiki and just ask for general advice in the chat then you realize how easy it is to make money and gain xp.

The community that plays this sim is fantastic. Especially once you level up and move on from the starter state and get to the places where the true players really are. Everyone is always more than happy to give you assistance or advice if you ask and as long as you are just as willing to give out advice yourself you can easily become respected within the community. The devs are great as well, they are active on the forums and are always busting their butts to try and sort out issues and help new and seasoned players alike.

Since this sim is in early access there are some bugs here and there but overall for me personally it's not too bad, only twice have I become concerned about losing my catch for the day which really isn't a big deal depending on what you are fishing. My one and only complaint is the major lack of tutorials and descriptions about what goes with what in the store. When I first started I was baffled by the amount of different things you could buy and wasted quite a bit of credits trying to figure things out, but again, read the wiki and ask in the chat and it is quickly sorted out and you are busy hauling in that fish.

I would absolutely reccomend this to anyone who enjoys fishing and is willing to take the time and learn the tricks of the trade.  Just remember three things: It's still in development, read the wiki, and upgrade your gear as it becomes available.

I used to think fishing was all about chance, but this game is very skill-based: if you use different techniqe you will catch entirely different fish even in the same pond.  It inspires me to go out into the real world and fish, something I never would have considered before, so obviously this is an excellent game, even if it is made by Russians.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Here is my opinion of the game in it's current state.

Graphics are really nice the trees are nice and has a nice nature feel to the game. The fishing starting out is a lot of bluegill and crappie. The gameplay mechanics are good except sometimes lag messes you up on fish. I see a lot of complaining about load times. I have not noticed anything abnormal about load times with my system anyway. I have seen a lot about errors and such...again I have not gotten this at all so far.

Currently it is bobber fishing if you are after catfish and such however I read that bottom fishing will be added later on. In my honest opinion the price point for premium is a bit expensive for a year. Would be much more reasonable at $60 per year or something equal to what you would pay for each game release that releases on a year to year basis. Premium is not required never the less. But it will certainly take time to level up without it.

My main complaint is the size of the trophy fish. They run quite small for most species I have seen. Where I am from a 15lb channel is not out of the realm at all. Bass also seem on the low side of what I would consider a trophy. I do hope this gets rectified in the future.

The fish graphics are pretty nice as well!

Game is certainly worth playing but will get better in the future. It does have some issues but nothing that can't be dealt with.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is incredible

+Extremely fair F2P model, you really do not need to spend any money to experience every single thing in the game

+Devs are very active in the community and respond quickly to bug reports, frequent updates

+Already lots of diversity in types of fish, locations, gear, styles of fishing

+Different fish require different methods of fishing

+Nice and engaging community

-Once you figure out how to catch a certain fish it's pretty easy to keep on catching them repeatedly

-Tutorial is lacking (Devs said that this is a priority to add upon)

I went through the reviews and the majority of negative reviews are coming from people whose PC's cannot run the game, or are TOO ♥♥♥♥ING STUPID TO FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS IN THE TUTORIAL (ARE YOU KIDDING ME? HOW CAN YOU BE THAT STUPID)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In the year 3036 there is only fish. What scattered remnants of man remain claw at a meager existence sucking nourishment from the prelapsarian cousins of the Earth's finned masters. Welcome to Fish Planet, fish or DIE.

Pros: Beautiful visuals, good sound. Incredible attention to detail on gear, fish and environment. Fishing rods, reels, and lures play completely differently befitting a sim". True free to play. It's a fishing game.

Cons: Early Access means less features right now. Occasional fail to load. Occasional crashes.

If you've never played a fishing game or haven't played since Super Black Bass on the SNES. Do yourself a favor and download this game for free. I can't wait for a multiplayer mode where you fish next to your buddies."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI have mixed feelings on this game. As far as the graphics and gameplay I think it is really awesome! But almost everytime I go to play I encounter some kind of bug. Whether its the endless loading screen, ghost inventory, menu glitches, etc.. It is very frustrating to have to force close the game and verify local files everytime I run the game. I understand it is only a few days after release but that also what bothers me. If you are going to release a game, shouldn't it work at least 90% of the time? And the bugs arent things you can play through, they are fatal errors that force you to close and re-open the game. Anyway I am sure this game will continue to improve as the developers continue to work in the coming weeks, and so right now, I give this game 8/10. When the bugs are fixed I would easily give it 10/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Honestly, I was skeptical at first having bought into dovetail games fishing and just plain disliking that, but this game was a pleasant suprise. I'm an avid fisherman and haven't been out much this year because I'm a full time college student (summer classes too...). This game has scratched that itch and will continue to do so every winter when I just want to be out bass fishing.
It's early access, so I assume things will only improve from here on out, but it's a solid game. The graphics are awesome, fighting with a fish seems awesome (except when you yank a small fish out of the water and it flies around you...but it's a laugh at least), and the sheer number of items is impressive. I personally dislike that it's the type of game that deals with in game purchases and such, but the game is totally playable without spending a dime. Getting started until you reach level 3-4 is a bit of a grind, but after then is when the game truly becomes fun. The community is great, I get into discussions about all sorts of things and we help each other with game tips. All in all, it's a great experience and it's a relaxing break from your regular day to day.
I definitely recommend this game to any fishing fan.

Early Access Review

Fishing since a long time, I really find this game great and so promising.
Strike are really realistic, and you can guess what fish it will be from it. Fish behavior is also well simulated.
The dev support is really top, and even if there is still some bugs (it's still Early Access and what game did not ? ), they react fast, take users feedback into account, and keep their promise.
If you have fishing experience, try it, if you don't but want to discover this great sport, try it also : it's FREE (you really can start without paying a cent, and if you love this game you will want to pay for it).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A free-to-play, always online game that looks great, has an always-online feature with servers that are only occasionally down for patches and maintanence, has gameplay that will be enjoyable for the niche gamers it clearly appeals to, and it doesn't even try to force microtransactions down your throat via mental manipulation (they're still there if you want to support the devs, though).

(UPDATE) Although a large part of the game is grinding out levels to get better equipment/locations, the game becomes vastly more enjoyable once you reach higher levels and are able to catch (relatively) massive fish.

The only thing I do not like is that you can't move your character very much at all. This is not a pay to play game. All the stuff you buy in game, you earn from catching fish. reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is good but buggy at times...  To be honest my biggest complaint is that my camera view keeps getting off center after about an hour of playing and I have to quit and restart.  The fish don't act like normal fish at times.  When you try to catch the fish they are much smarter than normal fish in that they can rapidly create slack on the line and get off the hook unnaturally fast.  It's fine for now and it's still a good game.

After playtesting the game for a few days I have a few recommendations for the game to make it's replay ability better.  It would be more exciting if you could walk around the lake and have to find the fishing spots.  Seasons should also be introduced in order to change fishing style throughout the 4 season.  Fly fishing should be included in the game.  Also the lakes should be larger and different boats should be introduced in order to access locations unavailable by foot.  I would also spread the experience across the fish more so that players don't go for the same fish all the time.  It seems that at each lake there is only one fish that gives a good amount of experience while the rest don't give enough experience to make them worth fishing.  I know the game isn't finished and these are only suggestions to the developers....

Other than that the game is great with a lot of potential.  Definitely worth playing for a while.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I went into the water to drink and bathe in the river, to get the smell of the fish so they would accept me into their fold. Slowly and surely I gained their trust, and adopted their language, culture, and ways. The great chief look to me as the next leader for the tribe, and I already gained the love of his daughter. Soon I was caught between two worlds, my fellow fishermen or my new fishy brethen. I went to consult the source of wisdom for the fish, the great and powerful submerged river truck tire. It spoke to me of a war that will come to take the lives of my fish tribe, and the evil of man and their great machines of war. What will happen to me I do not know, but this game is ♥♥♥♥ing awesome if you love fishing.
10/10 Half fish, half man babies

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After a day of strressful work (or stressful gaming) this an incredibly satisfying, yet relaxing casual fishing simulator.  I have not played too many fishing sims but I have played enough to find this one far more enjoyable.

If you are highly competitive even in your casual gaming you will probably not find this appealing at the moment.  Multiplayer exists and the community is really great -- but there are no tournaments and you're left with a leader board for each fishing location but nothing super special.

And of course if you are super competitive you will be frustrated by the DLC and micro transactions.  When approached from the perspective of a casual game, I find the micro transactions to be distateful but much less bothersome.

As with most fishing sims, you are of course rewarded more for catching the popular kids" of the sport fishing world (Bass
recommended: Pike ect ect) but you are still able to progress/level with trout
hoursPlayed:
catfish and panfish.  They are actually how I grabbed some decent ingame cash early on though they fade in importance over time.

The graphics are enjoyable but at the moment the software is certainly not optimized.  I regularly have minor (read: non-game breaking) graphical errors.

The sound track is peaceful and enjoyable as well.

In short
voteText:
if you want to actually feel like you're really fishing with complicated sporting gear in the actual environment...you need to purchase a fishing license and go out side.

But if you're interested in casually gaming and like fishing this is not a bad option and honestly one of the best currently availabe (though that says so little).

"
helpfulPercent: January 8
votesHelpful: true
votesFunny: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you like actual fishing, you will like this game.  Very realistic, beautiful scenery and sound effects.  You need to learn and use different techniques to catch fish in this game, I'm certain I've learned quite a bit for the next time I go to drown some worms in real life.

You won't find announcer's voices or underwater views or any of that stuff.  You're holding a rod, watching the tension of the line or the bobber.  Just like real life.

The DLC is a little pricey, but you can earn and purchase all sorts of gear totally from in-game cash, if you're willing to grind a little.  Once you get past a certain level and purchase the right tackle you can start to get the ball rolling. Free.

A very relaxing and fun game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's a pretty fun game in the few hours I have played. The graphics are pretty, and the fishing is fun once I figured out what I was doing.

It does have a few rough patches like all early access games do though. The weather pattern in the different fishing spots is exactly the same each 'trip' and I think a bit more variety would be nice. I also am one of those people who uses a keyboard layout other than the standard US QWERTY, and it would be nice if I could re-bind controlls to the keys I actually have, or if there was controller support. That and a few glitches like being unable to reliably set up your rod when buying new gear is annoying.

On the bright side though, it is free!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Summary:

Played a couple hours and overall a pretty decent game. It is a little different from fishing games I remember playing in the past but it's not bad. At the start it was a bit annoying having the control map pop up while the tutorial was going. I think that it should have been less invasive and have a little bubble stating press F1 for controls" or something like that. Also the control map has some faded lines pointing to the keys which are a bit hard to follow. I kind of feel like a noob but just a suggestion... If you catch a fish that is supposed to be a release under the license equipped maybe once you catch that restricted fish it should have a notice that fades away saying if you keep the fish you'll get fined. I messed up and kept 2 fish in New York on a basic license and it made me go negative and now I can't fish til tomorrow. I can see this game getting a little repetative over time once I have caught a majority of the fish. Otherwise it's pretty relaxing
date:
just throw some music on in the background grab a beer (age 21+) kick back and cast out.

Pros:

Beautiful graphics
Variety of gear/fish/methods to catch them
Communication to others in server (chatting and notifications of fish caught)

Cons:

Looking around/movement is a bit floaty
Needs more clarity on license restrictions real time

I'll do a better review when I get more time in the game and have more knowledge about the game."

voteText: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As an older bloke but still relatively new to online gaming, I was sick and tired of the shoot em ups I normally play and sought something more relaxing. Due to my disability, I have not been fishing in the real world for years, so when I stumbled across this game in steam, for free, well I just had to give it a go. And I am very glad I did.

It is so relaxing to play. I love the scenery, I love the way some of the smaller fish can put up a great fight. The background sound effects are lovely. And I really enjoy the friendly banter in the on screen chat box. If you are the kind of gamer that likes to compete with others, you can play it that way and try to level up as quick as you can, and there a tons of guides to help you find the tricks and tips, I however, really enjoy the slower route, figuring things out for myself, and just enjoying the game for what it is. A marvelous way to relax and recuperate from my recent heart attack, and a smashing alternative to the find gun, load gun, kill em all type of game that I have been playing up untill now.

A truly brilliant game, thank you to all the Dev's, for making this, and releasing it for free. Brilliant. 10 out of 10 from me.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Absolutely a fun game to play for a bit to kill time or to sit down and relax with some fishing. Alot of people are complaining about the fishing mechanics of the game and others things, it's free to play and simulation games (especially ones like these) are hard to get all the mechanics down. The game has to pay attention to so many factors to try and replicate real fishing which is very demanding. So the fact that many people think the game is broke or too easy there's a few simple things you can do
1. Post actual problems in the forum rather than QQ because you can't fish right.
2. Remember that the game is still in early dev so there is going to be problems, get over it.
2. Uninstall and move on. It's not a game for everyone and it's f2p so you're not loosing anything.

Overall mechanics are solid to play, different baits to use so there plenty of variety, many updates that come out everyday to improve.

Will rate it 8.5-9/10 for simulators.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Trophy Bass 4 >>>>> current state of Fishing Planet


edit -

after 17 hours or so i'll say this... and i still stand by my initial review... the actual fishing" mechanics of the game is OK so far. at it's base it's fun. but what makes it boring? shore fishing. it gets old pretty fast from static points. there needs to be boats
hoursPlayed:
etc. i doubt we'll see it on a scale like trophy bass 4 where entire real lakes are mapped and you could travel to any point on it.

the "grind" to use gear is fairly boring. it also feels like the fish Quality scales to lures you unlock. maybe there's some RNG involved to get trophies on worse things but i havent seen it yet.

also the semi-forced "you must fish varied species" to level quicker is pretty Carrot on a Stick. im interested in bass fishing only. you should be able to grind the game fishing how YOU want to fish ("you can just way slower because one lake doesnt have a species you want to fish").

combining lures and different types of rigging... why use anything but jigs with hook guards for cover fishing? why can't i make a jig-n-pig combo? i can't texas rig my worms or tubes. what if you want to wacky rig?

more casts... the casting is too generic. there needs to be flips

It got very boring... and i have time to play it, i cant imagine ppl that only have 3 or 4 hours to play at most every day. dont even try it. Idea was good graphics is good  but... lets say imagine if u can click same button and looking at it nonstop every second for 7 days 18 hours a day, then this game is for you.

Original Review:  15 April 2016

This review is an initial reaction after 3 days.

I will need to come back and edit this review after I've spent more time in here.

I picked up this game in early April
votesFunny: just as 0.3.7 update (Texas) arrived.\n\nHaving read about 5 reviews and seeing a 'mostly positive' rating on STEAM
commentsCount: I downloaded.\n\nInstallation was easy during which I watched a few YouTube videos. By installation complete
column16: I knew enough to get out and go fishing.  A few hand holds greet you as you first play and they're great. Within no time
column17: I'd been fishing. I can easily stay out of the 'realistic discussions' as I'm no real life angler but I appreciate the degree to which this title has achieved certain aspects of the real world activity.\n\nAny simulator is a compromise but if it's not fun
column18: then it's no good. I can certainly see myself spending a while here and there going fishing between my other simulator gameplay activities.\n\nSo with 3 days under my belt
column21:
found it very relaxing and enjoyable and even experienced my first update which adds a huge attraction to the title.

I expect I will go ahead and purchase some items from the shop as I develop my experiences.

I tend to be wary of 'free to play' in a title but not against them or even spending some money on this as long as I can get value and the money I spend remains as purchased value.

One area I am slightly concerned about is the purchased license validity time. If they are in terms of 'Game time'
column22: then I will be happy. If they are real time however.... I will be quite disappointed.\n\nI am totally happy I took the time to check this title out and immediately
column23: I would encourage anyone wondering about it
column24: to try it out.\n\nHere is a youtube video of my early on session.   https://youtu.be/ovcQ_yb54Fg"

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game really took me by surprise! I am typically more into FPS, Fighting and MMORPG's - I gave this game a try because it was free, and boy was it a decision that I am happy I made. This game is seriously a ton of fun, I could literally spend hours playing this game. I got to learn a lot about fishing tactics, best methods, and more than I ever would have expected from a fishing simulator. The graphics are nice, the environment and ambient sounds are a masterpiece as well... the game, within a few minutes can take you away from the daily grind and helps you feel relaxed. The only drawback is, I can't really cook the fish. Aside from that, downloading, installing and playing this game is highly recommended. It is also very addictive and hours will go by because of all the fun you'll be having and not even know it. Leveling is perfect and keeps you begging for more.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pro:
+ Free to play (completely free - you don´t need to buy anything atm to get to the so called endgame" aka highest map)
+ mostly friendly (and a bit older) playerbase
+ captures the feeling of RL fishing really good for me in this early stages of developement
+ can not confirm the negative feedbacks of many here as i started playing the game after those "nerfs" and did not get used to earlier "freebies"
+ has the "just one more bite for today " factor that will lead to you forgetting the clock sometimes
+ ok graphics
+ needs some good reflexes later on to catch some of the fish
+ fun to explore the zone with different rods/reels/bait combinations

Con:
- some grind has to be done in the current state of the game later on if you want to reach the highest maps
- atm all players share the same spots - so there is nothing to explore if you follow the shortcut the chat has to offer as they will lead you to the sweet spots - but this will be changed most likely sooner than later


As it is free to download - i recommend it to everyone that likes fishing - you can´t do something completely wrong here at all.
And if you don´t like it - just give feedback before you quit and help making a better game out of it.

and now back to catching some more of those bass ^^

gl and hf everyone"

First of all, the game is very promising, not just there yet, but has potential of being the best Fishing Simulator so far. But let's check the pros and cons

Pros:

- Not just a game, a super realistic simulation

- Fully customizable equipment from rods&reels to your hat&boots

- Many ways to fish, many places to fish

- Again, realistic gameplay forces LICENSES (awesome!)

- Good visuals

Cons:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'll start with the cons of this simulator, and follow up with the pros.  This is my opinion based on years of playing fishing games and spending countless hours fishing in real life.  (Note: I've read the most recent dev blog post, and it appears that the developers are hard at work already on some of this.  Good stuff!)

=== Cons ===

Physics - line slack in water doesn't correlate with how much line is released; confusing fish catches (the fish seem to 'fly' or teleport out of the water upon catching).

Xbox 360 controller - doesn't feel right with the controls of this game.  No game controller configuration options.

Controls - out of sync with fish bites; casting is a pain (no level of casting power?  simply click and hope for the best?); hooking/reeling fish is a confusing ordeal (fish on?  tension?  visual/audio feedback?  doesn't seem the game adds excitement to fish retrieval).

XP/currency - too much emphasis on points and currency rather than skills; microtransactions - a nice option, but seems to be designed as a cash grab.  Please - DO make money on this - development costs money.  But don't sacrifice fun and realism by making it pay-to-win.

Fish AI - unrealistic expectations (i.e. 'use a 16 inch leader with a size 6 hook').  Following guidelines to increase the odds of catching a fish is good - but forcing players to stick to a formula and grind away is just not fun.

Music - need more of it.

Interface - a bit confusing; example: ESC key does different things or nothing at all; GUI needs to be consistent amongst the different screens.

=== Pros ===

Graphics - WOW - spot on!  They are truly amazing.  3D texturing, beautiful ambience, plenty of attention to detail with the tackle/baits/etc.

Music - I've only heard a single track so far, but it's good.  That is the style that is fitting for a fishing simulation, and I'd love to hear more others like it!

Fish species - It's nice to see no limitation imposed; carp, bass, catfish, sunfish, etc. - they all matter.

Realism - FINALLY, no forced underwater view!  No annoying announcers.  No arcade elements.  A simulation :-)

Tutorials - A nice touch.

Support / dev feedback / wiki - Some of the best I've seen anywhere.  Listening to your user base and keeping them 'in the loop' will help keep this game thriving for years to come.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's a fun game and could really become a great one. As an avid fisherman myself, the dynamics and such make sense. It is easy and at time, very frustrating -- just like fishing.

The developers take into account the different combination of lures, colors, sizes, and such for different areas. Thus, giving you huge amount of combination to try and catch different types of fish.

Also, if you were having a bad year of fishing (which I was), this gives you some ability to try out fishing ideas in a simulated setting. Overall, I would recommend it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For a fishing game, and me being a fisheran, I have found this game to be very true in so many respects, while there are some minor problems with how the ine acts, and reacts to the water, and the casting mechanics can sometimes be wonky, HOWEVER, the fish all respond the proper way, they hit the baits the same way real fish do, and their fights are much the same as in real life as ye can get without actually feeling the rod bend in your hands and the thrill of the first solid hook.

The only other problem is that it will run your video card on the hot side due to the fact that they rendered the entire space and the trees on the far side of the water area, as wel as the water surface and reflections, so that graphics card can get a real workout, but it is VERY Much Worth it if you are a real fisherman.  So far I have managed to take the time and slowly, oh so slowly, bring in a 17+lb Flathead Catfish on 8 lb test.  Just a matter of playing him out, letting him run under light but constant, wearing tension, the tension keeps it moving to escape, which will, eventually, hopefully, tire it out so that you can then slowly bring it in to you.

So, I would Heartily Reccomend this game to any and all folks wo either fish or would like to learn how.

Say HI" to Cutch fer me
date: I visited him long ago and got my copy of DeerHunter 2K5 from him
hoursPlayed: knew some of the folks my grandparents did

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Logged in not having a huge amount of hope for this game, having played just about every sports hunting and fishing game made at least a few hours. By the time I stepped up to the bank I was swatting mosquitoes away from my ears.

This game is very good for a fishing sim, if you like that stuff. If you liked other fishing games this one will blow you away.

You must use proper baits, depths, rod/reel setups, etc. The immersion is nice too. I spent a evening just cat fishing because it was fun.

I would not recommend this to anyone looking for action, or fast paced anything. This game is made to hang out, chill, relax catch a few fish and chat with others doing the same thing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I found this gem after watching a livestream and was very interested. As an avid outdoorsman and fishermen, I wanted to see what a F2P game had to offer. While it is still in early access, it is still a very fun game to play. Tons of content and more still to come. Travel America fishing for the premier freshwater fish. From pan fish to bass, predatory fish, float fishing, trout, salmon, and even the mighty sturgeon, this game is an easy and fun way  to fish if you've never been or do it all the time. As in real life, spending money on stuff that you may never use is a bad move. Before buying, ask yourself, will I need this after Missouri, or Colorado, or New York(btw don't go here after you unlock it, its a bad move, wait until you are higher level or you will be in debt and get stuck. 8.5/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ok, so as a real life avid fishermen, I can say that this game is freakin amazing!  The devs did a very good job with this game.  I cannot wait till they come out with a bunch more updates.  As for right now, there is plenty to do and never even a second or boredom as you are always going for that rare trophy fish and attain new achievements.

It is very good to see so many people enjoying this game.  I have been fishing in game what seems like a few hours a day and it's totally enjoyable.  Make sure you have drinks and snacks nearby.

I would like to see fly fishing, saltwater fishing, and the ability to purchase and upgrade tracker type boats with trolling motors etc. and upgrades to everything as you level and gain cash and gold.

Get the game today if you love to fish or even if you have never tried it but want to become a fantastic virtual fishermen.

See you in game.

p.s. Watch out for the occasional attack bear....

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game really took me by surprise! I am typically more into FPS, Fighting and MMORPG's - I gave this game a try because it was free, and boy was it a decision that I am happy I made. This game is seriously a ton of fun, I could literally spend hours playing this game. I got to learn a lot about fishing tactics, best methods, and more than I ever would have expected from a fishing simulator. The graphics are nice, the environment and ambient sounds are a masterpiece as well... the game, within a few minutes can take you away from the daily grind and helps you feel relaxed. The only drawback is, I can't really cook the fish. Aside from that, downloading, installing and playing this game is highly recommended. It is also very addictive and hours will go by because of all the fun you'll be having and not even know it. Leveling is perfect and keeps you begging for more.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have never fished in real life...
I have never been interested in fishing...
Then I was introduced to this game..

At first I was like OK this is boring but then after leveling up and catching different types of fishes I got hooked (pun intended).
Really fun game and I've actually learned alot. And I can happily say that this game is so satisfying I never ever have to go fishing IRL.

When fishing in the game it actually sounds like I'm at a real river or lake. Sometimes there is annoying little birds or whatever making noise and irritates me. But it sounds very real.
The maps are very beautiful.. Lovely little mountains on some... Just trees on others.
One map i really like is Florida. Looks amazing.
There is a nice variety of fishies and the best one imo is the Walleye.

So far a very good game!! Cant wait til they add more maps (EU SOON!!) and more fishies :D

I just downloaded this game, excited to play it since I love fishing simulators. But for some reason whenever I start to play the game, the camera keeps switching from the ground to the sky. I can't control it and I don't know if it's me, the game, or my computer. My laptop has all the credentials needed to play the game, it's just the camera thing that I have the problem with. If anyone knows how to fix this problem please let me know.

Aside from this problem, if this game is as awesome as it says it is, I would definitely recommend it.

==UPDATE==
Found the solution in the troubleshooting page. Guess my computer wasn't up to standard after a quick test. Everything's working fine now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very realistic fishing game, plus it's online and have coop
Even the close beta is so awesome, great graphic, it pretty hard but that make it so interesting
People who think this game like the other Pay2win game that you need to spend money a lot to be great
the answer is NO, this game is PLAY TO WIN, Not PAY TO WIN. So you don't need to buy DLC to be the best in the game
It only help you if you really want to progress faster, because all thing in DLC is available in game store with pretty decent price, only need to play little bit longer to unlock it
I'm a beta tester and i able to caught lot of big fish without DLC, premium only help you progress, you still able to buy everything. You can get In-game money and Gold from fish and achievement to buy better gear and it's not that hard if you have good experience and know how to catch one.

Would recommend to play, 100% FreeToPlay and PlayToWin (not PayToWin)
DLC and your money only make you progress faster and you can get everything just by playing

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is how early access games should be done. start off with a mainly bug free game that has enough functionality to be playable for many hours and plenty of content place holders so people can easily see what is coming in the future.

The graphics look amazing, especially at 4k, and it's amazing how many hours just disappear as you're sitting there hauling in the fish.

The object of the game is quite simple. Catch fish to earn money, spend that on equipment to help you catch more/bigger fish to make more money. Get enough money to go to different places where there are different fish and repeat the cycle.

If you like fishing sims then this is for you. Play it but don't whinge if your machine isnt up to spec.
If you dont then why are you reading this?

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nVery good so far but level progression off the get-go feels a bit slow just to get from 2 to 3. Graphics and presentation for the actual fisihing are outstanding. Free-roam is pretty much non-existent as the game boxes you into small locations to fish from which is a bit disappointing considering where most video games are at today. Item and gear selection is REALLY limited in the beginning and there doesn't appear to be many options as you level up but the game is in early access" so I'm sure that will improve. What would make this game feel like the complete package is a real feel of free-roam and options to fish from; kayaks
hoursPlayed: in-app purchases are in the game's menu's for upgraded gear/experience which is a real turn-off to me. I would have no problem purchasing a game like this outright if it meant I didn't have to deal with in-app purchase schemes which always seem to give a video-game a cheap assembly line feel."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Back long ago, in a wonderful time, I sat in a room and played some sort of Fishing Tournment game on console (PS2 or Dreamcast I am not sure, cloudy days back then) for hours. This game brought back the memories, its Clean, simple, but not to arcadish. Hands Down the best fishing game in the last century.

Be warned like many Early Release games, ask for help or better yet look up help/guides.

Great game would give many thumbs and fins up!
